oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shiloh MB Church: front
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church front. The brick building contains a gable roof, gable vent, steeple, gable-roofed portico, double doors, and a cornerstone. Windows flank the doors. A cement walkway leads to the front entrance.

Shiloh Missionary Baptist Church was founded in 1900 by Reverend Daniel L. Gaines. The current building in Cleveland, Tennessee dates to 1980. At the time of fieldwork in 1998, the church building retained "good integrity" and was located in a "small suburban African American community."
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Church buildings
